channel.title: Banking on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in Banking on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Finansbank Logo
QNB Finansbank is a Turkish bank with headquarters in Levent, Istanbul. It was established by leading Turkish banker Hüsnü Özyeğin in 1987 and for a period was the Turkish bank with the largest network of foreign branches. In 2016 the QNB Group headquartered in Doha, Qatar, acquired Finansbank from the National Bank of Greece, which had purchased the bank’s domestic operations back in 2006, spinning the international operations off under the name Credit Europe Bank.
You can download theFinansbanklogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Finansbank
item.description: QNB Finansbank is a Turkish bank with headquarters in Levent, Istanbul. It was established by leading Turkish banker Hüsnü Özyeğin in 1987 and for a period was the Turkish bank with the largest network of foreign branches. In 2016 the QNB Group headquartered in Doha, Qatar, acquired Finansbank from the National Bank of Greece, which had purchased the bank’s domestic operations back in 2006, spinning the international operations off under the name Credit Europe Bank.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
First Chicago Bank Logo First Chicago Bank was a Chicago-based retail and commercial bank tracing its roots to 1863. Over the years, the bank operated under several names including The First National Bank of Chicago and First Chicago NBD. In 1998, First Chicago NBD merged with Banc One Corporation to form Bank One Corporation, today a part of Chase. Source
You can download theFirst Chicagologo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: First Chicago
item.description: First Chicago Bank was a Chicago-based retail and commercial bank tracing its roots to 1863. Over the years, the bank operated under several names including The First National Bank of Chicago and First Chicago NBD. In 1998, First Chicago NBD merged with Banc One Corporation to form Bank One Corporation, today a part of Chase. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 First Citizens Bank Logo
First Citizens Bancshares, Inc. is a bank holding company based in Raleigh, North Carolina. Its primary subsidiary is First Citizens Bank. It is on the list of largest banks in the United States. As of December 31, 2019, the company operated 574 branches in 19 states; however, 72% of the bank’s deposits were in North Carolina and South Carolina. For three generations, the bank has been led by the family of Robert Powell Holding, who joined the bank in 1918 and rose to president in 1935.
You can download theFirst Citizenslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: First Citizens
item.description: First Citizens Bancshares, Inc. is a bank holding company based in Raleigh, North Carolina. Its primary subsidiary is First Citizens Bank. It is on the list of largest banks in the United States. As of December 31, 2019, the company operated 574 branches in 19 states; however, 72% of the bank’s deposits were in North Carolina and South Carolina. For three generations, the bank has been led by the family of Robert Powell Holding, who joined the bank in 1918 and rose to president in 1935.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 First Republic Bank Logo
First Republic Bank is an American bank and wealth management company offering personal banking, business banking, trust, and wealth management services, catering to low-risk, high net-worth clientele, and focusing on providing personalized customer experience. The bank specializes in delivering personalized relationship-based service through preferred banking or trust offices in the United States, including San Francisco, Palo Alto, Los Angeles, Santa Barbara, Newport Beach, San Diego, Portland, Palm Beach, Boston, Greenwich, New York City, Jackson, Wyoming, and Manhattan Beach.
You can download theFirst Republiclogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

item.description: First Republic Bank is an American bank and wealth management company offering personal banking, business banking, trust, and wealth management services, catering to low-risk, high net-worth clientele, and focusing on providing personalized customer experience. The bank specializes in delivering personalized relationship-based service through preferred banking or trust offices in the United States, including San Francisco, Palo Alto, Los Angeles, Santa Barbara, Newport Beach, San Diego, Portland, Palm Beach, Boston, Greenwich, New York City, Jackson, Wyoming, and Manhattan Beach.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
EQ Bank Logo
Our mindset is anything but ordinary and we are constantly challenging ourselves. We adapt. We ask, “what’s the smarter way to do things?” Practically, that looks like giving our customers a way to earn more without the usual banking nonsense– like hidden fees, archaic policies, and paying for services that they don’t use. Plus we have top-notch security and every dollar is eligible for CDIC deposit protection—which means your money is always secure.
You can download theEQ Banklogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: EQ Bank
item.description: Our mindset is anything but ordinary and we are constantly challenging ourselves. We adapt. We ask, “what’s the smarter way to do things?” Practically, that looks like giving our customers a way to earn more without the usual banking nonsense– like hidden fees, archaic policies, and paying for services that they don’t use. Plus we have top-notch security and every dollar is eligible for CDIC deposit protection—which means your money is always secure.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Akbank Logo
Akbank T.A.Ş. is one of the largest banks in Turkey. Founded in 1948, As of 2017, it had revenues of nearly TL 13.7 billion. Listed on the Borsa Istanbul, its largest shareholders are members of the Sabancı family. Akbank has ranked as “The Most Valuable Banking Brand in Turkey” according to the “Brand Finance - Banking 500, 2018” report for the seventh time in a row. Akbank also achieved significant success by ranking as the 126th most valuable banking brand in the report that comprises the most valuable global banking brands.
You can download theAkbanklogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

item.description: Akbank T.A.Ş. is one of the largest banks in Turkey. Founded in 1948, As of 2017, it had revenues of nearly TL 13.7 billion. Listed on the Borsa Istanbul, its largest shareholders are members of the Sabancı family. Akbank has ranked as “The Most Valuable Banking Brand in Turkey” according to the “Brand Finance - Banking 500, 2018” report for the seventh time in a row. Akbank also achieved significant success by ranking as the 126th most valuable banking brand in the report that comprises the most valuable global banking brands.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Allahabad Bank Logo
Allahabad Bank was an Indian nationalised bank with its headquarters in Kolkata, India. Founded in Allahabad in 1865 and nationalized by the government of India in 1969, the bank provided banking and financial services for 155 years until it was merged with Indian Bank in 2020. It was also the oldest joint stock bank in India. As of 31 March 2018, Allahabad Bank had over 3245 branches across India. The bank did a total business of ₹ 3.
You can download theAllahabad Banklogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Allahabad Bank
item.description: Allahabad Bank was an Indian nationalised bank with its headquarters in Kolkata, India. Founded in Allahabad in 1865 and nationalized by the government of India in 1969, the bank provided banking and financial services for 155 years until it was merged with Indian Bank in 2020. It was also the oldest joint stock bank in India. As of 31 March 2018, Allahabad Bank had over 3245 branches across India. The bank did a total business of ₹ 3.
